panels.title: Source

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: ci-runners Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{component="",monitor="global",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: ci-runners Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{environment="$environment",monitor="global",stage="$stage",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",tier="runners",type="ci-runners"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: ci-runners Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation
Jobs running on GitLab Inc. runners (by shard)

panels.content:
In short: problems with autoscaling will reduce (even totally) the capacity of our Runners.

**It's recommended to review the graphs after limiting the shard variable to only
the part of Runners that we want to analyse.** Otherwise the number of different lines
may be overwhelming. Please also remember that **different shards have different autosacling
settings**, where the `shared` one is the most outstanding at it creates a VM dedicated for
every job and removes it just after the job is finished.

**We're currently in the process of moving to a new autoscaling mechanism.** For now there are no
known guidelines as to how to work with it and what to review in case of troubles. We will be
udpating this description after getting some more experience with using that new method.
panels.title: autoscaling-new caused incident notes

title: ci-runners: Incident Support: autoscaling-new
